headline: Eat Like You’re Building Stability
body: Your nervous system thrives on rhythm. It doesn’t want perfection—it wants predictability and fuel.
prompt: What rhythm shift—like consistent meals or a solid breakfast—could you test this week for more calm?

headline: You Don’t Just Feed the Body—You Feed the Brain
body: Every cell runs on nutrients. Healing begins when nourishment is consistent, calming, and conscious.
prompt: What’s one small upgrade you could make to how you feed your brain this week?

headline: Mental Health Starts in the Gut
body: Your belly and brain are in constant conversation. Feed one, and the other learns to soften.
prompt: What food or ingredient could you test removing—or adding—to better support emotional steadiness this week?

headline: You Can’t Think Clearly Without the Right Fuel
body: Mood and memory need minerals. If your brain feels dim or unstable—check what it’s running on.
prompt: What nutrient have you been meaning to check or add back in—and could this week be the time?

headline: Your Cravings Aren’t Just Hunger—They’re Messages
body: Cravings speak the language of need: rest, regulation, or nourishment. You can listen without shame.
prompt: What craving has been showing up this week—and what core need might it really be pointing toward?

headline: The Brain Runs on What You Feed It
body: You don’t just regulate emotions—you feed the cells that feel them. Nourish your system, and it will support you back.
prompt: What small upgrade could you make to feed your focus, calm, or resilience this week?
